summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Sixty-second Street from Twenty-eighth Avenue Northwest to a point two hundred forty (240) feet west of the west margin of Thirty-second Avenue Northwest, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, openings, flush tanks, manholes, lampholes, catch basins and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewerage and drainage of said district, all in accordance with Resolution No. 1282 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
